title: 104_hr1497
content: The Act titled "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" revises the limitation on the deduction of policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" amends the deduction limitation for policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The deduction for any taxable year is capped at 90% of policyholder dividends or 30% of taxable income, with a minimum limit of $35,000,000. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" amends the deduction limitation for policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The deduction for any taxable year is capped at 90% of policyholder dividends or 30% of taxable income, with a minimum limit of $35,000,000. Additionally, Section 809 is repealed. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" repeals Section 809 of the Code and makes various amendments to sections related to policyholders' share of tax-exempt interest. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" repeals Section 809 of the Code and makes amendments to various sections related to tax-exempt interest. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1994, with exceptions for certain provisions. The Act repeals Section 809 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and imposes limitations on loss carrybacks for life insurance companies. Capital losses after December 31, 1994, cannot be carried back to years before January 1, 1995. The Act repeals Section 809 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and imposes limitations on loss carrybacks for life insurance companies. Small life insurance companies are exempt from capitalizing certain policy acquisition expenses starting from December 31, 1994. Congress intends for any increased revenues to be used for deficit reduction, tax incentives for small life insurance companies, and programs benefiting children's nutrition, education, housing, and family support.
